FuncDef:
The traffic match user-group command configures EDSG service traffic to match a user group.
The undo traffic match user-group command disables EDSG service traffic from matching a user group.
By default, no EDSG service traffic is configured to match a user group.
CLIs: undo traffic match user-group [ inbound | outbound ]
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In NAT/DS-Lite load-balancing scenarios, different user groups are mapped to different NAT/DS-Lite services and user traffic is load-balanced based on multiple user groups. In NAT/DS-Lite load-balancing scenarios, after user traffic matches EDSG services, it must continue to match a user group for NAT/DS-Lite service selection. To match upstream or downstream EDSG service traffic to a user group, run the traffic match user-group command.
Configuration Impact
After the traffic match user-group command is run, user traffic is load-balanced to the corresponding NAT/DS-Lite service if it matches the UCL of the user group.
After the traffic match user-group command is run in the EDSG service policy view, EDSG service traffic is enabled to match a user group. If the EDSG service's traffic policy is consistent with the traffic direction for the service traffic to match a user group and the traffic behavior applied in the EDSG service's traffic policy is bound to a NAT instance (the nat bind instance command is run in the traffic behavior view), the service traffic is redirected to the NAT/DS-Lite service board and the service group does not match a user group.
Precautions
The traffic match user-group command can be locally configured but cannot be delivered using RADIUS.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
